abstract.p: Minneapolis and New York offices of Fallon Worldwide win most honors in the agency category at ninth annual show sponsored by Association of Indepoendent Commercial Producers, NY, honoring work on television commercials (Advertising column) (S)

block.p: At the ninth annual show sponsored by the Association of Independent Commercial Producers in New York, honoring work on television commercials, the Minneapolis and New York offices of Fallon Worldwide won the most honors in the agency category.

At the ninth annual show sponsored by the Association of Independent Commercial Producers in New York, honoring work on television commercials, the Minneapolis and New York offices of Fallon Worldwide won the most honors in the agency category.

Fallon, part of Publicis S.A., won 11 honors for campaigns for clients like BMW of North America, Holiday Inn and MTV. Arnold Communications in Boston followed with six honors for campaigns for Royal Caribbean International and Volkswagen of America. Arnold is part of Snyder Communications, which is being bought by Havas Advertising.

Headquarters in New York and Santa Monica, Calif., was awarded the most honors in the production company category, five, for spots for Amazon.com, Sega of America and Visa. The advertisers whose commercials won the most honors were Nike and Volkswagen.
